side_b:
Shape: Diplococcus
Staining: Gram -ve
Pathogenicity: Capsule-mediated immune evasion, endotoxin release
Signs: Meningitis, petechial rash, septicemia, DIC

Shape: Diplococcus
Staining: Gram -ve
Pathogenicity: Pili-mediated adhesion, antigenic variation, immune evasion
Signs: Urethritis, cervicitis, PID, neonatal conjunctivitis

Shape: Coccobacillus
Staining: Gram -ve
Pathogenicity: Capsule (type B), IgA protease, endotoxin
Signs: Meningitis, epiglottitis, pneumonia, otitis media

Shape: Bacillus
Staining: Gram -ve
Pathogenicity: Various pathotypes (EPEC, ETEC, EHEC, UPEC), toxin production, adhesion factors
Signs: Diarrhea (watery or bloody), UTI, HUS, neonatal meningitis

Shape: Bacillus
Staining: Gram -ve
Pathogenicity: Intracellular survival, Vi capsule, endotoxin release
Signs: Typhoid fever (fever, diarrhea, rose spots, hepatosplenomegaly)

Shape: Bacillus
Staining: Gram -ve
Pathogenicity: Invasion of M cells, intracellular survival, endotoxin-mediated inflammation
Signs: Gastroenteritis (nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, fever)

Shape: Comma-shaped bacillus
Staining: Gram -ve
Pathogenicity: Cholera toxin (cAMP activation, Cl- secretion)
Signs: Profuse watery diarrhea, dehydration, electrolyte imbalance

Shape: Bacillus
Staining: Gram -ve
Pathogenicity: Invasion of colonic epithelium, shiga toxin (ribosome inhibition)
Signs: Dysentery, bloody diarrhea, fever, abdominal cramps

Shape: Cocci (clusters)
Staining: Gram +ve
Pathogenicity: Exotoxins (TSST-1, enterotoxins), coagulase, protein A
Signs: Skin infections, pneumonia, sepsis, endocarditis, TSS, food poisoning

Shape: Cocci (chains)
Staining: Gram +ve
Pathogenicity: M protein (immune evasion), exotoxins (SPEs), hemolysins
Signs: Pharyngitis, tonsillitis, rheumatic fever, scarlet fever, necrotizing fasciitis

Shape: Cocci (chains)
Staining: Gram +ve
Pathogenicity: Capsule-mediated immune evasion, beta-hemolysis
Signs: Neonatal sepsis, pneumonia, meningitis

Shape: Cocci (chains)
Staining: Gram +ve
Pathogenicity: Adhesion to heart valves, biofilm formation
Signs: Dental caries, subacute bacterial endocarditis

Shape: Diplococcus
Staining: Gram +ve
Pathogenicity: Capsule (antiphagocytic), IgA protease, pneumolysin
Signs: Pneumonia, otitis media, meningitis, sinusitis

Shape: Bacillus
Staining: Gram +ve (spore-forming, anaerobic)
Pathogenicity: Toxin A (enterotoxin), Toxin B (cytotoxin)
Signs: Pseudomembranous colitis, watery diarrhea, abdominal pain

Shape: Bacillus
Staining: Gram +ve (spore-forming, anaerobic)
Pathogenicity: Tetanospasmin (blocks inhibitory neurotransmitters)
Signs: Spastic paralysis, lockjaw, muscle spasms

Shape: Bacillus
Staining: Gram +ve (spore-forming, anaerobic)
Pathogenicity: Botulinum toxin (blocks ACh release at NMJ)
Signs: Flaccid paralysis, respiratory failure, blurred vision

Shape: Bacillus
Staining: Gram +ve (spore-forming, anaerobic)
Pathogenicity: Alpha toxin (lecithinase, tissue destruction), enterotoxins
Signs: Gas gangrene, food poisoning

Shape: Bacillus
Staining: Gram +ve
Pathogenicity: Intracellular survival, actin polymerization for motility
Signs: Meningitis in neonates, gastroenteritis, sepsis in immunocompromised

Shape: Bacillus
Staining: Gram -ve
Pathogenicity: Biofilm formation, exotoxins, antibiotic resistance
Signs: Pneumonia, UTIs, wound infections, sepsis

Shape: Coccobacillus
Staining: Gram -ve
Pathogenicity: Biofilm formation, multidrug resistance, intracellular survival
Signs: Nosocomial pneumonia, wound infections, sepsis

Shape: Cocci (clusters)
Staining: Gram +ve
Pathogenicity: Biofilm formation, prosthetic device colonization
Signs: Prosthetic joint infections, catheter infections, endocarditis

Shape: Cocci (chains)
Staining: Gram +ve
Pathogenicity: Biofilm formation, antibiotic resistance (VRE strains)
Signs: Endocarditis, biliary tract infections, UTIs
